Description: Book of the Dead of Pabik or Penhor; red and black ink and black outline vignettes verso and recto.
Curator's comments: EA9976 is the top half of a papyrus and joins P. JPGM 83.AI.46.8 at the Getty Museum: https://www.getty.edu/art/collection/object/103Y00 (as discovered by Foy Scalf, Institute for the Study of Ancient Cultures, Chicago)

Mosher, Malcom Jr. 2016. The Book of the Dead, Saite through Ptolemaic periods : a study of traditions evident in versions of texts and vignettes (SPBD Studies), vol. I (BD Spells 1-15) and II (BD Spells 16, 18-30), Charleston. To be published by Foy Scalf, Institute for the Study of Ancient Cultures, Chicago.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (153)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57503) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57503)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, discoloured, loss, brittle Black ink (loss) Red ink Inlaid: brown paper Supported locally: glassine paper Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: D Curatorial condition comment: incomplete - bottom edge lost
